topic.title: TWI Access Command

body.p: MRPC Command ID: 0x01
The TWI Access Command provides external access to the on-chip TWI peripheral buses. Two sub-commands are supported: Read and Write.

row.entry: TWI master transaction timeout and bus recovery success
TWI master transaction timeout and bus recovery fail
Failed recovery after slave address set failure
Master activity during slave address set attempt

topic.domains: (topic hi-d) (topic ut-d) (topic indexing-d) (topic hazard-d) (topic abbrev-d) (topic pr-d) (topic sw-d) (topic ui-d) (topic struct-d) (topic firmware-d) (topic pmcrevhis-d)
topic.title: TWI Access - Read Sub-Command

body.p: This sub-command issues a read operation on a specified on-chip TWI peripheral bus.

table.title: TWI Access Command Read Input Data

body.p: Specifies the TWI Access Sub-Command. Set to 0x0 for the read operation.
On-chip TWI port ID
7- or 10-bit slave address. 7-bit addresses are entered in 8-bit format, so they must be left-shifted by one bit.
Slave device address offset to start to read.
Number of bytes to read. Must be less than 1012.
Indicates the format of the Slave Address:
0 - 7-bit address
1 - 10-bit address
0: no offset
1: 8 bit offset
2: 16 bit offset
4: 32 bit offset

table.title: TWI Access Command Read Output Data

body.p: Data read from TWI slave device. The return data is formatted as little-endian format Dwords.

topic.domains: (topic hi-d) (topic ut-d) (topic indexing-d) (topic hazard-d) (topic abbrev-d) (topic pr-d) (topic sw-d) (topic ui-d) (topic struct-d) (topic firmware-d) (topic pmcrevhis-d)
topic.title: TWI Access - Write Sub-Command

body.p: This sub-command issues a write operation on a specified on-chip TWI peripheral bus.

table.title: TWI Access Command Write Input Data

body.p: Specifies the TWI Access Sub-Command. Set to 0x1 for the write operation.
On-chip TWI port ID
7- or 10-bit slave address. 7-bit addresses are entered in 8-bit format, so they must be left-shifted by one bit.
Slave device address offset to start to write.
Number of bytes to write. Must be equal or less than 1012.
Indicates the format of the Slave Address:
0 - 7-bit address
1 - 10-bit address
0: no offset
1: 8 bit offset
2: 16 bit offset
4: 32 bit offset
Data buffer to write.
There is no output data for this sub-command.

topic.domains: (topic hi-d) (topic ut-d) (topic indexing-d) (topic hazard-d) (topic abbrev-d) (topic pr-d) (topic sw-d) (topic ui-d) (topic struct-d) (topic firmware-d) (topic pmcrevhis-d)
topic.title: TWI Access - Master Line Reset Sub-Command

body.p: This sub-command issues a Slave Reset on a specified on-chip TWI peripheral bus.
Specifies the TWI Access Sub-Command. Set to 0x2 for the master line reset operation which could trigger the attached slave devices reset by toggling the SRSTB pin.
On-chip TWI port ID
Flag to indicate whether to perform the Master Recovery or not. 1 to perform, 0 to no perform.
Indicates for the time(ms) master pull the reset pin.
The master line reset operation will be performed automatically during TWI master initialization and recovery when it's enabled in Configuration File. See TWI Master Line Reset

note.p: This sub-command should not be used in the TWI multi-master topology.

topic.title: TWI Access - Command Example

body.p: Suppose TWI0 is connected to a SEEPROM whose address is 0xA0.

li.p: Read result from offset 0x808 after writing to 0xA0
Read status from offset 0x804 after writing to 0xA0

p.cmdname: #Hints: The result should be the same as what we have written previously
